verses.text_plain: Why standest thou afar off, O Lord? why hidest thou thyself in times of trouble?
verses.verse_html: 1Why standest thou afar off, O Lord? why hidest thou thyself in times of trouble?

verses.text_plain: The wicked in his pride doth persecute the poor: let them be taken in the devices that they have imagined.
verses.verse_html:
2The wicked in his pride doth persecute the poor: let them be taken in the devices that they have imagined. ▼
▼ The wicked…: Heb. In the pride of the wicked he doth persecute

footnotes.body_text: ▼ The wicked…: Heb. In the pride of the wicked he doth persecute
footnotes.body_html: ▼ The wicked…: Heb. In the pride of the wicked he doth persecute

verses.text_plain: For the wicked boasteth of his heart’s desire, and blesseth the covetous, whom the Lord abhorreth.
verses.verse_html:
3For the wicked boasteth of his heart’s desire, and blesseth the covetous, whom the Lord abhorreth. ▼
▼ heart’s: Heb. soul’s
 , ▼
▼ blesseth…: or, the covetous blesseth himself, he abhorreth the Lord

footnotes.body_text: ▼ blesseth…: or, the covetous blesseth himself, he abhorreth the Lord
footnotes.body_html: ▼ blesseth…: or, the covetous blesseth himself, he abhorreth the Lord

verses.text_plain: The wicked, through the pride of his countenance, will not seek after God: God is not in all his thoughts.
verses.verse_html:
4The wicked, through the pride of his countenance, will not seek after God: God is not in all his thoughts. ▼
▼ God is…: or, all his thoughts are, There is no God

footnotes.body_text: ▼ God is…: or, all his thoughts are, There is no God
footnotes.body_html: ▼ God is…: or, all his thoughts are, There is no God

verses.text_plain: His ways are always grievous; thy judgments are far above out of his sight: as for all his enemies, he puffeth at them.
verses.verse_html: 5His ways are always grievous; thy judgments are far above out of his sight: as for all his enemies, he puffeth at them.

verses.text_plain: He hath said in his heart, I shall not be moved: for I shall never be in adversity.
verses.verse_html:
6He hath said in his heart, I shall not be moved: for I shall never be in adversity. ▼
▼ never: Heb. unto generation and generation

footnotes.body_text: ▼ never: Heb. unto generation and generation
footnotes.body_html: ▼ never: Heb. unto generation and generation

verses.text_plain: His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and fraud: under his tongue is mischief and vanity.
verses.verse_html:
7His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and fraud: under his tongue is mischief and vanity. ▼
▼ deceit: Heb. deceits
 , ▼
▼ vanity: or, iniquity

verses.text_plain: He sitteth in the lurking places of the villages: in the secret places doth he murder the innocent: his eyes are privily set against the poor.
verses.verse_html:
8He sitteth in the lurking places of the villages: in the secret places doth he murder the innocent: his eyes are privily set against the poor. ▼
▼ are…: Heb. hide themselves

footnotes.body_html: ▼ are…: Heb. hide themselves

verses.text_plain: He lieth in wait secretly as a lion in his den: he lieth in wait to catch the poor: he doth catch the poor, when he draweth him into his net.
verses.verse_html:
9He lieth in wait secretly as a lion in his den: he lieth in wait to catch the poor: he doth catch the poor, when he draweth him into his net. ▼
▼ secretly: Heb. in the secret places

footnotes.body_text: ▼ secretly: Heb. in the secret places
footnotes.body_html: ▼ secretly: Heb. in the secret places

verses.text_plain: He croucheth, and humbleth himself, that the poor may fall by his strong ones.
verses.verse_html:
10He croucheth, and humbleth himself, that the poor may fall by his strong ones. ▼
▼ He…: Heb. He breaketh himself
 , ▼
▼ by…: or, into his strong parts

footnotes.body_html: ▼ He…: Heb. He breaketh himself

footnotes.body_text: ▼ by…: or, into his strong parts
footnotes.body_html: ▼ by…: or, into his strong parts

verses.text_plain: He hath said in his heart, God hath forgotten: he hideth his face; he will never see it.
verses.verse_html: 11He hath said in his heart, God hath forgotten: he hideth his face; he will never see it.

verses.text_plain: Arise, O Lord; O God, lift up thine hand: forget not the humble.
verses.verse_html:
12Arise, O Lord; O God, lift up thine hand: forget not the humble. ▼
▼ humble: or, afflicted

verses.text_plain: Wherefore doth the wicked contemn God? he hath said in his heart, Thou wilt not require it.
verses.verse_html: 13Wherefore doth the wicked contemn God? he hath said in his heart, Thou wilt not require it.

verses.text_plain: Thou hast seen it; for thou beholdest mischief and spite, to requite it with thy hand: the poor committeth himself unto thee; thou art the helper of the fatherless.
verses.verse_html:
14Thou hast seen it; for thou beholdest mischief and spite, to requite it with thy hand: the poor committeth himself unto thee; thou art the helper of the fatherless. ▼
▼ committeth: Heb. leaveth

tokens.text: himself unto thee; thou art the helper

verses.text_plain: Break thou the arm of the wicked and the evil man: seek out his wickedness till thou find none.
verses.verse_html: 15Break thou the arm of the wicked and the evil man: seek out his wickedness till thou find none.

verses.text_plain: The Lord is King for ever and ever: the heathen are perished out of his land.
verses.verse_html: 16The Lord is King for ever and ever: the heathen are perished out of his land.

verses.text_plain: Lord, thou hast heard the desire of the humble: thou wilt prepare their heart, thou wilt cause thine ear to hear:
verses.verse_html:
17Lord, thou hast heard the desire of the humble: thou wilt prepare their heart, thou wilt cause thine ear to hear: ▼
▼ prepare: or, establish

verses.text_plain: To judge the fatherless and the oppressed, that the man of the earth may no more oppress.
verses.verse_html:
18To judge the fatherless and the oppressed, that the man of the earth may no more oppress. ▼
▼ oppress: or, terrify
